I20060213-0010

Steps:

* Debug to a breakpoint
* In variable view detail pane type "java.lang.System.getProperties()" and inspect the result
* Press Ctrl-Shift-I again to persist the result to the expression view
* expression is persisted, but dialog closing causes NPE

*** Bug 127756 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 126683 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The installed handler first persists the popup, then closes it.  The InspectPopup will either show the expression view or bring it to the top.  This can cause the shell to be deactivated, which will trigger a close in the middle of the persist.  So by the time the handler tries to close the dialog, it's already closed.

I don't see a problem with this on the debug side, as the bounds are saved the first time the dialog is closed, so it's acceptable to code around the problem in PopupDialog by checking for a null or disposed shell.

Fixed >20060214-1600.
PopupDialog#close() will first check to see if it has already been closed.
MVM, this should go into M5.  Fix is low risk and it's easy to trigger.

verified on I20060215-0010, Win XP
the scenario in comment #0 works now with no NPE
